name: Buffalo Rotisserie Chicken Dip Pizzas
author: thedailygourmet
summary: This Buffalo dip is fast to make thanks to rotisserie chicken, and the beauty of this dip is how versatile it is. I chose to transform it to a pizza topping but you can just serve it with dippers, too.
ingredients: 5 ounces shredded skinless rotisserie chicken breast
½ (8 ounce) package cream cheese, cubed
1 tablespoon blue cheese crumbles, or to taste
directions: Melt butter in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) set to Saute function
Scatter chicken in the bottom of the pot
Top with Buffalo sauce, then ranch mix, and finally cream cheese cubes; do not stir
Pour in chicken broth and hit Cancel
Select low pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 8 minutes
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Place 2 flatbreads on a baking sheet
Spread 1/2 of the dip on each one and top with mozzarella cheese
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is golden brown, about 14 minutes
